verses.verse: Through <S%H8378>desire<s%> a man, having <S%H6504>separated<s%> himself, <S%H1245>seeketh<s%> and <S%H1566>intermeddleth<s%> with all <S%H8454>wisdom<s%>. Through: or, He that separateth himself seeketh according to his desire, and intermeddleth in every business
A <S%H3684>fool<s%> hath no <S%H2654>delight<s%> in <S%H8394>understanding<s%>, but that his <S%H3820>heart<s%> may <S%H1540>discover<s%> itself.
When the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> <S%H935>cometh<s%>, then <S%H935>cometh<s%> also <S%H937>contempt<s%>, and with <S%H7036>ignominy<s%> <S%H2781>reproach<s%>.

The <S%H1697>words<s%> of a <S%H376>man's<s%> <S%H6310>mouth<s%> are as <S%H6013>deep<s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%>, and the <S%H4726>wellspring<s%> of <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> as a <S%H5042>flowing<s%> <S%H5158>brook<s%>.
It is not <S%H2896>good<s%> to <S%H5375>accept<s%> the <S%H6440>person<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>, to <S%H5186>overthrow<s%> the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> in <S%H4941>judgment<s%>.
A <S%H3684>fool's<s%> <S%H8193>lips<s%> <S%H935>enter<s%> into <S%H7379>contention<s%>, and his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7121>calleth<s%> for <S%H4112>strokes<s%>.
A <S%H3684>fool's<s%> <S%H6310>mouth<s%> is his <S%H4288>destruction<s%>, and his <S%H8193>lips<s%> are the <S%H4170>snare<s%> of his <S%H5315>soul<s%>.

The <S%H1697>words<s%> of a <S%H5372>talebearer<s%> are as <S%H3859>wounds<s%>, and they go <S%H3381>down<s%> into the innermost <S%H2315>parts<s%> of the <S%H990>belly<s%>. talebearer: or, whisperer as wounds: or, like as when men are wounded most: Heb. chambers
He also that is <S%H7503>slothful<s%> in his <S%H4399>work<s%> is <S%H251>brother<s%> to him that is a <S%H1167>great<s%> <S%H7843>waster<s%>.
The <S%H8034>name<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> is a <S%H5797>strong<s%> <S%H4026>tower<s%>: the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> <S%H7323>runneth<s%> into it, and is <S%H7682>safe<s%>. safe: Heb. set aloft
The rich <S%H6223>man's<s%> <S%H1952>wealth<s%> is his <S%H5797>strong<s%> <S%H7151>city<s%>, and as an <S%H7682>high<s%> <S%H2346>wall<s%> in his own <S%H4906>conceit<s%>.
<S%H6440>Before<s%> <S%H7667>destruction<s%> the <S%H3820>heart<s%> of <S%H376>man<s%> is <S%H1361>haughty<s%>, and <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H3519>honour<s%> is <S%H6038>humility<s%>.
He that <S%H7725>answereth<s%> a <S%H1697>matter<s%> before he <S%H8085>heareth<s%> it, it is <S%H200>folly<s%> and <S%H3639>shame<s%> unto him. answereth: Heb. returneth a word
The <S%H7307>spirit<s%> of a <S%H376>man<s%> will <S%H3557>sustain<s%> his <S%H4245>infirmity<s%>; but a <S%H5218>wounded<s%> <S%H7307>spirit<s%> who can <S%H5375>bear<s%>?
The <S%H3820>heart<s%> of the <S%H995>prudent<s%> <S%H7069>getteth<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>; and the <S%H241>ear<s%> of the <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H1245>seeketh<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>.
A <S%H120>man's<s%> <S%H4976>gift<s%> maketh <S%H7337>room<s%> for him, and <S%H5148>bringeth<s%> him <S%H6440>before<s%> great <S%H1419>men<s%>.
He that is <S%H7223>first<s%> in his own <S%H7379>cause<s%> seemeth <S%H6662>just<s%>; but his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%> <S%H935>cometh<s%> <S%H935><s%> and <S%H2713>searcheth<s%> him.
The <S%H1486>lot<s%> causeth <S%H4079>contentions<s%> to <S%H7673>cease<s%>, and <S%H6504>parteth<s%> between the <S%H6099>mighty<s%>.

A <S%H251>brother<s%> <S%H6586>offended<s%> is harder to be won than a <S%H5797>strong<s%> <S%H7151>city<s%>: and their <S%H4079>contentions<s%> <S%H4066><s%> are like the <S%H1280>bars<s%> of a <S%H759>castle<s%>.

A <S%H376>man's<s%> <S%H990>belly<s%> shall be <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> with the <S%H6529>fruit<s%> of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%>; and with the <S%H8393>increase<s%> of his <S%H8193>lips<s%> shall he be <S%H7646>filled<s%>.
<S%H4194>Death<s%> and <S%H2416>life<s%> are in the <S%H3027>power<s%> of the <S%H3956>tongue<s%>: and they that <S%H157>love<s%> it shall <S%H398>eat<s%> the <S%H6529>fruit<s%> thereof.
Whoso <S%H4672>findeth<s%> a <S%H802>wife<s%> <S%H4672>findeth<s%> a <S%H2896>good<s%> thing, and <S%H6329>obtaineth<s%> <S%H7522>favour<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
The <S%H7326>poor<s%> <S%H1696>useth<s%> <S%H8469>intreaties<s%>; but the <S%H6223>rich<s%> <S%H6030>answereth<s%> <S%H5794>roughly<s%>.
A <S%H376>man<s%> that hath <S%H7453>friends<s%> must shew himself <S%H7489>friendly<s%>: and there <S%H3426>is<s%> a <S%H157>friend<s%> that sticketh <S%H1695>closer<s%> than a <S%H251>brother<s%>.
